entry.title: Germany calls for Nagorno-Karabakh settlement on basis of self-determination

media:group.media:title: Germany calls for Nagorno-Karabakh settlement on basis of self-determination
media:group.media:description:
üìçGerman Chancellor Olaf Scholz called for the settlement of the Nagorno-Karabakh conflict to be reached with the principles of territorial integrity and self-determination for the citizens of Nagorno-Karabakh being seen as ‚Äúequally applicable‚Äù üìçAzerbaijan remains the main obstacle to Armenia-Turkey normalization, said Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan. üìçArmenian Foreign Minister Ararat Mirzoyan and his Russian counterpart, Sergey Lavrov, discussed Azerbaijan‚Äôs ongoing blockade of Nagorno-Karabakh at talks in India.

entry.title: Key Karabakh reservoir‚Äôs water levels drop amid blockade

media:group.media:title: Key Karabakh reservoir‚Äôs water levels drop amid blockade
media:group.media:description:
üìçWater levels in Nagorno-Karabakh‚Äôs largest reservoir, Sarsang, have dropped significantly due to Azerbaijan‚Äôs ongoing blockade. üìçThe Armenian government has given the green light to a proposal to construct a $120 million ski resort in Armenia‚Äôs Aragatsotn region. üìçThe Armenian government also approved $2.5 million in funding for the design and cost estimates for a new metro station in Yerevan‚Äôs Ajapnyak neighborhood.

entry.title: Aliyev loses in the World Court

media:group.media:title: Aliyev loses in the World Court
media:group.media:description:
In the latest episode of Insights with Eric Hacopian, Eric discusses the International Court of Justice‚Äôs ruling last week to order Azerbaijan to lift its blockade of Artsakh (Karabakh), now past its 80th day. Eric also talks about Ruben Vardanyan‚Äôs dismissal as Karabakh‚Äôs state minister and the humanitarian impact of the ongoing blockade on Artsakh‚Äôs people.

entry.title: Establishing a citizens‚Äô assembly in Armenia

media:group.media:title: Establishing a citizens‚Äô assembly in Armenia
media:group.media:description:
Richard Wilson, the CEO of the ISWE Foundation, sat down with CivilNet to discuss a joint project with the Future Armenian initiative to establish citizens‚Äô assemblies in Armenia. Wilson explained what exactly a citizens‚Äô assembly is, why Armenia needs them and how the diaspora will be involved.
